TITLE: End of an era: Who comes after Kerry?
SUMMARY: Potential successors include Kerry deputy Sue Biniaz, Washington Gov. Jay Inslee and longtime political operative John Podesta.

TITLE: No more going wobbly in climate fight, Trump supporters vow
SUMMARY: For all his bombast, the former president's agencies hesitated to rewrite federal climate reports or install loyalists atop key science agencies. Some of his allies expect that to change.

TITLE: John Kerry to step down as Biden climate envoy
SUMMARY: The veteran diplomat helped craft the 2015 Paris climate agreement, and more recently led the U.S. team at COP28 in Dubai.

TITLE: Congress approves resolution against Biden EV charger plans
SUMMARY: The measure targets a limited waiver from Buy America rules. Democrats and the White House say it would backfire.

TITLE: Biden’s aides weigh climate test for natural gas exports
SUMMARY: Biden faces growing pressure from environmental groups to live up to his pledge to transition away from fossil fuels.

TITLE: ‘It’s a scary time’ as world shatters temperature record
SUMMARY: And 2024 may bring more of the same.

TITLE: The race for Romney’s seat is a fight about climate
SUMMARY: John Curtis is making his climate pitch in a state that had a long history of coal production in the aptly named Carbon County.

TITLE: Azerbaijan taps former oil industry leader to head this year's climate talks
SUMMARY: The selection stands to raise questions about the role of fossil fuel executives in global climate negotiations.

TITLE: One Southwest power project’s 17-year odyssey shows the hurdles to Biden’s climate agenda
SUMMARY: U.S. climate goals will drift out of reach if expanding amounts of renewable electricity can't reach cities and suburbs.

TITLE: 'We can reclaim control of our destiny,' Al Gore says of climate change
SUMMARY: The former vice president found hope in the possibility that humans have the tools to repair the planet.

TITLE: Why the battle over electric cars is primed to take off
SUMMARY: “In my district, … this is not playing well,” GOP Rep. Lisa McClain said. “And let’s be honest, Michigan is a very influential state for the upcoming election.”

TITLE: ‘Historic success’: John Kerry touts COP28 agreement
Western states are brawling over the Colorado River. That could spell trouble for Biden.
SUMMARY: The hard-fought negotiations over how to share the pain from shrinking water supplies will affect tens of millions of people and powerful farming interests.

TITLE: US green groups see new leverage from Biden’s COP28 promise
SUMMARY: Green groups have stepped up their attacks on individual projects they say will lock in consumption of fossil fuels for decades.

TITLE: From ‘depressed’ to a milestone: How the climate deal came together
SUMMARY: “There were times in the last 48 hours where some of us thought this could fail,” U.S. climate envoy John Kerry said later.

TITLE: ‘The crisis has arrived’: An elder statesman unpacks the battle over the West's water
SUMMARY: Former Interior Secretary Babbitt talks about the big meeting in Las Vegas this week and the kind of concessions needed to save the crucial waterway.

TITLE: Climate summit makes ‘historic progress’ — but the world still can’t quit oil
SUMMARY: The contradictions in nations’ attitudes toward fossil fuels were at the forefront of the talks in Dubai.

TITLE: COP28 ends with first-ever call to move away from fossil fuels
SUMMARY: The nearly 200-nation agreement "has the potential to redefine our economies," summit president Sultan al-Jaber said as the deal drew a standing ovation.

TITLE: Trump pulled America out of Paris. So why are these Republicans in Dubai?
SUMMARY: GOP lawmakers came to the U.N. climate summit to champion U.S. energy while acknowledging the need to cut carbon. But will that matter if Trump returns to the White House?

TITLE: Greens erupt as fossil fuel ‘phaseout’ is dropped from proposed climate deal
SUMMARY: “COP28 is now on the verge of complete failure,” former U.S. Vice President Al Gore said. But organizers of the summit in Dubai urged nations to be flexible and compromise.

TITLE: 'Bidenomics' is a big hit — outside the US
SUMMARY: The president's signature climate law, with its massive subsidies and push for domestic manufacturing, has leaders across the UK, Australia and Europe scrambling to follow suit. But American voters seem unimpressed.

TITLE: A deadly delivery highlights ‘falsified’ heat records at USPS
SUMMARY: The Postal Service allegedly doctored heat training records of thousands of mail carriers. One of them died on a blistering day in June.

TITLE: Building wind power, canceling coal — it’s all drowning under borrowing costs
SUMMARY: Central banks' efforts to tame inflation have made it harder for both wealthy and poor nations to shift away from fossil fuels.

TITLE: Another win for oil states? Azerbaijan gets boost in bid to host next climate talks.
SUMMARY: The petroleum-rich country received a surprise endorsement from its arch-rival Armenia.

TITLE: Wind and solar pose climate threat too, oil giant Saudi Arabia argues
SUMMARY: The kingdom is elevating the use of fans and filters to pull carbon dioxide out of the sky. But its motives are under scrutiny at global climate talks.

TITLE: Catastrophic climate ‘tipping points’ may be imminent
SUMMARY: In a sweeping new report, hundreds of scientists warn that the world must rapidly phase out planet-warming emissions to avoid crossing dangerous thresholds.

TITLE: Republican House energy chair to skip COP28
SUMMARY: Republican Rep. Cathy McMorris Rodgers had been set to attend the climate summit with a bipartisan delegation but will miss it because of a scheduling conflict.

TITLE: Congress provided $7.5B for electric vehicle chargers. Built so far: Zero.
SUMMARY: The sluggish rollout could undermine President Joe Biden’s reelection messaging promoting electric vehicles.

TITLE: Wyoming weighs selling acreage inside Grand Teton National Park
SUMMARY: Opponents are worried about developers pouncing on land within an iconic national park in one of the nation's priciest real estate markets.

TITLE: Labor unions are still giving Democrats climate headaches
SUMMARY: Lawmakers are pouring billions into climate-friendly industries, but the jobs transition is lagging.
